options.text: Mission Landing Zone is a prescriptive reference architecture with reference implementation of a SCCA compliant Hub and Spoke virtual network provided by Microsoft.
Mission Landing Zone is configured for deployment into a single subscription or many subscriptions depending on your needs for resource counts, subscription boundaries, or billing.
All network traffic is directed through the Azure Firewall residing in the Hub Virtual Network and houses the Azure Bastion host for secure remote access into the network.

options.text: Mission Landing Zone deploys virtual networks configured for SCCA compliance.

SCCA guidance and architectures are specific to DoD customers, but they also help civilian customers comply with Trusted Internet Connections (TIC) guidance and help commercial customers that want to implement a secure DMZ to protect their Azure environments.
Make sure that the address spaces do not overlap with each other for the Hub, Identity, Operations, or Shared Services networks.

options.text: Mission Landing Zone comes bundled with built-in policies that can be applied to the resources it deploys and the ability to enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud for the subscriptions it is deployed into.
Mission Landing Zone comes bundled with a relevant subset of available Azure policies.
Enabling policies is optional, but recommended.

elements.name: deployPolicy
elements.label: Create policy assignments?
elements.toolTip: Check here to create policy assignments for the resources created by Mission Landing Zone.

elements.name: policy
elements.label: Policy Assignment
elements.toolTip: DoD IL5 is only available in AzureUsGovernment and will switch to NISTRev4 if tried in AzureCloud.
elements.defaultDescription: Select one of the bundled built-in policy assignments.

allowedValues.label: NIST SP 800-53 Rev4
allowedValues.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a catalog of security and privacy controls, Special Publication (SP) 800-53, for all federal information systems in the United States (except those related to national security).

allowedValues.label: NIST SP 800-53 Rev5
allowedValues.description: The US National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) publishes a catalog of security and privacy controls, Special Publication (SP) 800-53, for all federal information systems in the United States (except those related to national security).

allowedValues.label: DoD IL5
allowedValues.description: The Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) is an agency of the US Department of Defense (DoD) that is responsible for developing and maintaining the DoD Cloud Computing Security Requirements Guide (SRG). These policies are only available for AzureUsGovernment and will switch to NISTRev4 if tried in AzureCloud.

allowedValues.label: CMMC
allowedValues.description: The Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) is a new framework developed by the US Department of Defense (DoD) that requires formal third-party audits of defense industrial base (DIB) contractor cybersecurity practices.

options.text: Mission Landing Zone can activate Microsoft Defender for Cloud for each subscription it is deployed into.
Enabling Microsoft Defender for Cloud is optional, but recommended.

elements.name: deployDefender
elements.label: Enable Microsoft Defender for Cloud?

elements.name: emailSecurityContact
elements.label: Security Contact E-Mail Address
elements.toolTip: Provide an e-mail address as a security contact for Microsoft Defender for Cloud

validations.message: Provide a valid e-mail address

options.text: Mission Landing Zone can activate Azure Sentinel for the Log Analytics Workspace it deploys.
Enabling Azure Sentinel is optional, but recommended.

elements.name: deploySentinel
elements.label: Enable Azure Sentinel?
elements.toolTip: Check here to enable Azure Sentinel Center for the Log Analytics Workspace Mission Landing Zone deploys.

options.text: Mission Landing Zone can provision a Windows and a Linux virtual machine to securely access the network remotely using Azure Bastion hosts.
Enabling remote access is optional, but recommended.

elements.label: Remotely access the network?
